alert.note: Alert for Carter; Coal; Hughes; Johnston; Murray; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 24 at 10:40AM CDT until October 24 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Johnston County in southeastern Oklahoma... Western Coal County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southern Seminole County in east central Oklahoma... East central Carter County in southern Oklahoma... Pontotoc County in east central Oklahoma... Eastern Murray County in southern Oklahoma... South central Pottawatomie County in central Oklahoma... Western Hughes County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 1130 AM CDT. * At 1040 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Vanoss to near Scullin to 6 miles southwest of Mill Creek to 3 miles west of Mannsville, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Ada, Holdenville, Sulphur, Tishomingo, Wewoka, Konawa, Dickson, Byng, Allen, Roff, Ravia, Stonewall, Wapanucka, Tupelo, Mill Creek, Francis, Fitzhugh, Bromide, Sasakwa and Yeager. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Carter; Coal; Hughes; Johnston; Murray; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole
